Kallie Hill (she/her)




Kallie was born and raised in Santa Barbara and considers herself a California girl at heart. She studied Mathematics at UCSB as an undergrad, and began working for UCSB as an undergrad. After graduation she began working for the ECE dept here at UCSB, transferring after four years to the PBS Dept for an additional 4 years. She has now worked in the PSTAT Dept for two years, and considers Diversity, Equity and Inclusion to be the keystone in any working environment. In her spare time you can find her hanging out with her husband, Chris, and golden retriever, Atticus (Yes! Exactly like Atticus Finch! One of her fictional icons.)

title: DIVERSITY, EQUITY, and INCLUSION
text:
DIVERSITY, EQUITY, and INCLUSION


Department of Statistics and Applied Probability  University of California, Santa Barbara




Welcome to the homepage of the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) Subcommittee in the Department of Statistics and Applied Probability (PSTAT) at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB).
Here, you can learn about our department’s DEI mission statement, the officers currently serving on the DEI Subcommittee, and any upcoming events being hosted. We also hope to include links to useful resources (both on-campus and off-campus) relating to DEI, department climate, and many other related issues.
The best way to contact us is at dei@pstat.ucsb.edu. (Please note that sending an email to this address will result in an email being sent to all officers)

title: About
text:
At its core, our department views diversity and inclusion as critical within our mission to educate and prepare the future workforce of data scientists and quantitative thinkers. Increasing diversity across our field is essential in creating more productive, representative, and enriching outcomes as well as innovative solutions to critical problems. We recognize that historically, the job markets and academic communities in statistical theory and methods, financial mathematics, and actuarial science have been weighted toward racial, gender, and socioeconomically privileged communities. We are dedicated to correcting this imbalance in our own community.

–DEI Statement, from the PSTAT Main Webpage
